title: Bellows surgery Pt 1
body:
Got these Vorsatz m42 bellows for proper cheap on ebay. They’re Russian made and have Made in the USSR stamped on them. The quality check slip that came in the box is dated 1978. These pictures are from the listing, not taken by me:

Less convinced by this slidey tripod mount thing. Pretty solid and fine for lower magnifications probably, but I’m after something rock solid and easier to connect/ disconnect. Sorry weird slidey thing, time to go! :(

I’m using an arca swiss compatible plate instead:

There’s an arca clamp on the bench setup so this should be really easy to connect up.

Milling down unwanted ridges on the underside, slidey thing mounting bars already sawn out

Added a piece of flat aluminium bar to extend the back end a bit (because the arca plate is slightly longer than the bellows), filled with a bit of epoxy, filed and sanded down:

Doesn’t look great so far but should come together hopefully…
